title: ARAM with the current patch is.... terrible
body: I play a lot of ARAM. I like to play champs there that I never would on SR. Prior to the current patch I could expect maybe about 20% of the games were complete one sided uncompetitive blow outs, maybe 50-60% were tilted to once side but playable and the remainder were really close fun games. The complete one sided games were not fun but, eh, not a large enough % to overall make it a drag. Under the new patch, what ever the number is, the one sided blow out games are now 50-60% of the games. It's a real drag.  Yeah, I know ARAM is not suppose to be the competitive playground and they don't balance around it but having such a large % of games being one sided is just not fun.

replies.body:
I play aram exclusively and I agree with you completely. I came to the boards looking for a post about how now way more games are one sided stomp-fests. This is the only post I can find. Im really surprised there arent more posts about it and that this post got such unfriendly responses. Just because you don't know why its like this doesnt mean you dont know its happening, or cant write a post about it. 

I too dont know why its happening, just that it is. From what I know about the changes I would have guessed they would improve balance and fun. Being able to pick up the champ which was rr is a really nice change. Before you had to depend on the person asking if anyone wants their champ and then waiting for everyone to process that. Also now you can pick up the rr champ even if the person who originally had it doesnt own your champ. It just seems like a really good change. I am at a loss as to why now almost every game is decided in champ select. Maybe its the individual tweaks to the champs themselves. IDK. I can't even tell ahead of time which side has the advantage. Its like now it really comes down to individual champs, not comps. Tank comp can dominate with the right champs, or can be completely ineffective with the wrong ones. 

I wonder if the group healing change is part of the problem. It devalues champs which do damage over time and increases value of high burst. If you dont get the kill right away they just heal up.

Bottom line is I really dont know what is causing the problem but I do know Im already losing interest in aram because most games are now totally one sided.
What do you think the cause of that is?

I'm not entirely sure. It could be the champ swapping mechanic change so that any champ rr can just be grabbed ended up with more teams with people on champs they like.... or maybe the boots? I can't say for certain the cause but I am certain of the affect.

Sample size too small to mean anything at all, come back after a hundred or so games with actual stats.

That would give a rough idea. A statistician would reject anything under a few thousand samples with that sort of difference, though.

I play often enough to know the rough proportions and change in proportion are real and about what I said if not the exact number. Enough to give riot this feedback, which is my intent more than to generate exact statistics. I'm not going to argue about the error bars on my estimates.
0/10 absolutely no logic or reasoning behind repetitive complaint.
Well, pardon me for not reading all the forums get fully understand everyone's already expressed opinions. Snide dismissal 0/10,  not  offended.
What the fuck does that even mean and how is it remotely related to why you think ARAM is less balanced?
